name: A definitely normal powerpoint presentation
description: Made in unity engine, a "PowerPoint" presentation of social networking - advice on the safe use of the internet. At the very beginning, presenting itself as a normal PowerPoint presentation, this presentation is actually made in unity. After the 3rd slide, the computer gets a glitch effect and then fakes a blue screen of death. Later, the unity application mimics the user's desktop (A screenshot of the desktop is taken via a supporting c# application before the unity application launches), and causes an error to popup on the user's simulated desktop when he tries to click something. When he gets rid of said error, a second one appears and bounces around the screen. The presentation then reverts itself. After a few more slides, the player gains the ability to move in a 3d environment, in contrast to before, where he was fixed on a world canvas at a certain angle. This ability then reveals that the entire presentation was actually made in unity engine.
